    API keys generated by users
    Author:
    Hector Plahar

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserApiKeys

        public UserApiKeys(String userId)

    • Method Detail

      • requestKey

        public AccessKey requestKey(String clientId)
        Generates an access key
        Parameters:
        clientId - unique client identifier.
        Returns:
        wrapper around created token, client_id and secret.

        The api token that is generated and returned to the user is not stored and therefore cannot be retrieved. If lost, the api key record can be deleted by the user who created it (or an admin) and a new one created.

      • getKeys

        public Results<AccessKey> getKeys(int limit,
                                  int offset,
                                  String sortField,
                                  boolean asc,
                                  boolean getAvailable)
        Retrieves either list of available keys for current user or all keys. If requesting all keys then user must be an administrator
        Parameters:
        limit - maximum number of keys to retrieve
        offset - paging parameter start
        sortField - field to sort on
        asc - whether the retrieve order is in ascending order
        getAvailable - whether to retrieve all available keys or restrict by current user
        Returns:
        wrapper around list of retrieved keys including number available
        Throws:
        PermissionException - if getAvailable is true but user making the request does not have administrative privileges

      • deleteKey

        public boolean deleteKey(long id,
                         String secret)
        Deletes an api key
        Parameters:
        id - unique database identifier for the key
        secret - unique key secret
        Returns:
        true if the key is successfully deleted. false otherwise, including if the key cannot be found
        Throws:
        PermissionException - if the key being deleted does not belong to user and user does not have administrative privileges
